title: Rabbi Shmuley Boteach says he is why Ben Shapiro fired Candace Owens
message:
Living in New York City, I have had the opportunity to cross paths with many influential and well-known figures in the Jewish world.
Over the past few years, it has been a tremendous privilege to become close to Rabbi Shmuley Boteach, who is known as “America’s rabbi.”Boteach is an eloquent public speaker and writer, as well as a popular television and radio host.
He is the author of over 30 books, including The Israel Warrior: Fighting Back for the Jewish State from Campus to Street Corner.
event_breakdown: Examples of antisemitic events that can be placed on a map include the shooting at a synagogue in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania in October 2018 and the stabbing of a rabbi in New York City in November 2019.

title: Parade for Israel in NYC focuses on solidarity as Gaza war casts a grim shadow
message:
The parade comes almost eight months after the unprecedented Oct. 7 attack by Hamas, the deadliest in Israel's history.
There was never a thought of cancelling the parade this year, Treyger said, despite what he termed an astronomical rise in antisemitism.
That includes drones, K-9 units, bike patrols, fencing and barriers and designated entry points for spectators all along the parade route.
“We're not going to allow any unlawfulness and any disruption of any celebration of one’s heritage in this city,” New York City Mayor Eric Adams said at a security briefing.
Israel faces growing international criticism for its strategy of systematic destruction in Gaza, at a huge cost in civilian lives.

title: Parade for Israel in NYC focuses on solidarity this year as Gaza war casts a grim shadow
message:
FILE - Participants dance as they take part in the Celebrate Israel Parade Sunday, June 2, 2019, in New York.
A New York City parade for Israel that annually draws masses of people will step off Sunday with tight security and a stress on solidarity amid the war in Gaza.
(AP Photo/Craig Ruttle, file)NEW YORK – An annual New York City parade for Israel that draws thousands of people is scheduled to hit the streets Sunday with heightened security and a focus on solidarity during the war in Gaza.
The parade comes almost eight months after the unprecedented Oct. 7 attack by Hamas, the deadliest in Israel's history.
Israel faces growing international criticism for its strategy of systematic destruction in Gaza, at a huge cost in civilian lives.
event_breakdown: New York City will host its annual Celebrate Israel Parade on Sunday, amid a war between Hamas militants in the Gaza Strip and Israel. The parade's organizers have increased security and assigned a "special focus on solidarity" amid heightened tensions. The conflict in Gaza and Israel threatens to escalate after rockets fired from Gaza touched down in Israel. New York to Israel from New York, bringing thousands of people to the city.

title: University of Toronto graduation ceremonies set to begin with protest in background
message:
Sonja Puzic, The Canadian PressConvocation ceremonies for graduating University of Toronto students begin Monday against the backdrop of a pro-Palestinian encampment that has remained on campus for weeks despite a trespass notice and looming legal action.
More than 30 ceremonies are scheduled to take place through June 21 and the university says all events will proceed as planned with "extra precautions."
The University of Toronto said it takes the safety of graduating students and their guests “extremely seriously” and has a “well established” process to handle event disruptions.
An encampment at McGill University has been in place for more than a month, forcing the administration to move graduation ceremonies off campus to the Bell Centre, home of the Montreal Canadiens.
McGill president Deep Saini expressed frustration that encampment representatives walked away from the last meeting aimed at ending their protest.
event_breakdown:
Convocation ceremonies for graduating University of Toronto students begin Monday against the backdrop of a pro-Palestinian encampment that has remained on campus for weeks despite a trespass notice and looming legal action.
The University of Toronto said it takes the safety of graduating students and their guests “extremely seriously” and has a “well established” process to handle event disruptions.

title: UofT graduation ceremonies set to begin against backdrop of pro - Palestinian protest
message:
Convocation ceremonies for graduating University of Toronto students begin Monday against the backdrop of a pro-Palestinian encampment that has remained on campus for weeks despite a trespass notice and looming legal action.
“Folks graduating should attend (convocation) if they want to and we’re not taking any public stance on that,” Rasikh said.
“Please explain how U of T plans on ensuring a safe and meaningful graduation ceremony,” the parent wrote.
An encampment at McGill University has been in place for more than a month, forcing the administration to move graduation ceremonies off campus to the Bell Centre, home of the Montreal Canadiens.
McGill president Deep Saini expressed frustration that encampment representatives walked away from the last meeting aimed at ending their protest.
